result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keasean J Ellis-Brown

records.addlTxt: Atty Hotchkiss contact Court requesting adjournment. Court granted. Parties agree upon next court date. Case adjourned in Branch 4.

Defendant Keasean J Ellis-Brown in court, in custody.  Attorney William Hotchkiss in court for Keasean J Ellis-Brown.  Attorney Megan Marie Newport in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pretrial. State advises of request for joinder. Defense advises of request for adjournment of jury trial. Court will hear joinder motion at next hearing. Court grants adjournment of jury trial on 10-17-2022.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defense Response to State's Motion for Joinder.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Adjourn.
State's Requested Jury Instructions, received and filed.
State's Motion and Brief in Support of Joinder.
971.23(9) Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence at Trial.

Attorney William Hotchkiss in court, defendant Keasean J Ellis-Brown not in court, in custody.  Megan Marie Newport appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Discovery and offer received. Parties advise of status of case. Court sets trial date and advises if resolution before to contact court to schedule resolution date.  Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any other motions must be filed by the final pretrial. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Branch 4 down. Parties contacted to rescheduled. Parties agree to next court date. Parties notified. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Keasean J Ellis-Brown in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Megan Marie Newport appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Keasean J Ellis-Brown in court by video with Attorney William Hotchkiss who appears in person.  Defendant Keasean J Ellis-Brown in custody.  Megan Newport appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Stipulation to 21CF4484 agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective Scott Schmitz. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AW; CEH (DOB: 7/9/1987); KAVC (DOB: 2/8/1979)

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Keasean J Ellis-Brown in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Keasean J Ellis-Brown in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keasean J Ellis-Brown appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 5. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
